Before you hit 'Apply' on your dream job, 
pause and ask yourselfğŸ¤”

Are you truly prepared for this opportunity, or are you just aiming blindly?

Many professionals aim high, applying to tech giants and top MNCs, but often overlook the most critical partâ€”preparation.

Iâ€™ll tell you, that one of my friends once applied to their dream job role without revisiting concepts like system designs, DBMS, and OOP. 

When asked about designing a scalable system, they frozeâ€”not because they didnâ€™t know it, but because they didnâ€™t prepare enough.

So before you apply, take a moment to ask yourselfâ€”am I ready?
And if you are not planning and preparing: 

>> Identifying the gaps
It helps you focus on real weaknesses rather than just aimlessly practicing problems.

>> Expanding problem-solving skills
Make use of Leetcode, and HackerRank, to practice and understand different approaches and edge cases.

>> Mock interviews
Can make a big difference in how you present yourself during the interview.


So keep learning, keep practicing, and keep improving. The effort you put in will pay off eventually!

6. How do I avoid wasting years making random mistakes in my prep?

#mentorship #interviewpreparation #dsa #development #ai #jobinterviews #resume

>> System Design for SDEs

>> Mock Interviews 
If you canâ€™t explain your approach clearly under pressure, you wonâ€™t clear the interviews.

If youâ€™re lost in this process, connect with professionals whoâ€™ve cracked these roles. Their insights can save you months of trial and error.

If you are good at DSA, you are not a good software engineer
If you are good at Development, you are not a good software engineer
If you are good at System Design, you are not a good software engineer
If you are good at CS Fundamentals, you are not a good software engineer
If you are good at using AI in your work, you are not a good software engineer

If you have all of the above, then you will be called a great software engineer.

- Doing only DSA can help you crack 2-3 interview rounds. But what about projects?
- Doing only development can help you build projects? But what about Operating systems?
- Doing only CS fundamentals or System Design is never enough.
- AI can only be implemented with good development knowledge.

So you need to learn all of the above.

Companies are raising the bar.
Hiring managers are rejecting resumes faster than ever.
And the gap between â€œIâ€™m preparingâ€ and â€œIâ€™m readyâ€ is wider than you think.

check it out here: https://bit.ly/3HRGT9Y

And after 500+ hours of deep work that has gone into this product, it will make you a dangerous candidate:

âœ… It teaches you how to think like an engineer, not just solve problems.
âœ… It focuses on dsa patterns, projects, system design, cs fundamentals and AI.
âœ… It gives you a clear roadmap to go from â€œpreparingâ€ to â€œcracking offers.
